favourite.article: This has my testimony in it. God gets all the glory!
This song brings me back to my teens as a young Christian. It lifts your spirit when feeling low, helping you to make it through each day, knowing you are not alone in your walk of faith.

I am sick of sinful living. I am tired of this weary way. Christ is shining shining in my heart and revealing His light to guide my way. My husband is sick with fear and disease but I stand one with Christ my Savior that my husband will stand in victory today.
Amen to be overcomer.
My grandmother taught me this song from I was a child...missing her...

Eureka, Eureka! I found it in just one type of the title! I was in search of a song that was reminiscent of the past 36 years when first hearing this from an old Gospel Melodies Hymnbook. Uplifting, Rejuvenated and Revived. Singing, hearing and feeling the lyrics of this song gives healing. Thank You Lord for your mercy. Come Jesus Come!
Love this song -so many memories of part singing with friends in 1950s So uplifting, when feeling alone and hopeless -Jesus comes . X
If the Son therefore shall make you free, you shall be free indeed. hallelujah! There's nothing like knowing Him! Phil. 3:7-10
Thank God for websites like this. I have searched for this hymn and just typed in a few words from the first stanza. The music is very accurate and I am thankful.
I know the song and know the experience. All praise to Jesus.
I love this song my favorite since I was young.

Was reading in Mark 10 as Jesus approached Jericho, they came upon Bartimaeus, a blind man, who was begging along the road side. Then, I felt the Holy Spirit bring this song to my remembrance. I thought all the Billy Graham crusades where I had heard it sung. When Jesus comes powers of the evil one are broken. Jesus is our only hope in such a perverted world. He alone can set us free from sin.

I first heard this song sung by Lester Roloff in 1971 after I came to Christ. I often think of those precious words, "when Jesus comes the temptors power is broken." Sadly I have often failed my Lord, but gladly He has NEVER failed me.
What a wonderful Saviour Jesus is.
Precious words. True words. Jesus is the answer for all the ills of mankind.
This song encourages me every time I hear it and sing it.

I first heard this song in fall of 1953 in a youth sing along at my church high school Spring Vale Academy in Owosso, Michigan about 5 yrs ago I found it (w/out looking for it) in Spanish. Thanks to you today I found it in English. You've made my day and God has answered my prayer, by the way my dad was a minister for 69 of his 91yrs, I am 77 yrs old child of God, God bless you.

I've only heard this song sung once when I was a child but I've always remembered the words 'when Jesus comes, the tempter's power is broken'. It has been always been a great encouragement to me. I've been searching for the lyrics. What a blessing to be able to read all the words and sing it again.

W. B. McKay, a Pentecostal Holiness evangelist from Canada, sang this song in the late 1940s and early 1950s in the Pentecostal Holiness Church, in my neighborhood in Rocky Mount, NC during one of his revival services there. It is a great song and He comes to mind every time I hear it or think of it. Although he doesn't know it, I am grateful to him for introducing the message of this song to me.
I needed my life filled with glory, and oh, what glory it is. When, how, where it happened I can't remembered, but it happened. How could I not love Him for abiding in His glory!
I always thought the visit of a Jesus left a visitation of His power and His presence. It still does so for me today.
What a wonderful man for Christ! I went to a Billy Graham crusade in the 60s, and what a wonderful holy experience! God Bless George Beverly Shea, Billy Graham and the Tabernacle choir!
When I was newly saved, 9 years old, I sang this in my church as a solo. This song has stayed in my memory for 62 years. It has blessed me for many years.

One of my favorite songs, I included it on a CD made to give to people as part of my Christian witness. The message is clear to everyone and reminds us that our Lord Christ is the answer to all who turn to Him in faith, believing. Reading the Gospels - Matthew, Mark, Luke and John - the same answer is given 2000 years ago.

I grew up in Atlanta, Georgia. My father was a bi-vocational minister of music and had an extensive choir program in some large churches. He loved this song. He especially loved to hear it sung by a member of his choir who he encouraged to sing and use her talent from the time she was a young girl. She sang this song at his funeral.

I am going through a period of change and growth. This morning's bible devotion was entitled When Jesus comes and I immediately thought of this song. We only used to sing the chorus of this song when I was a child. I carried this song with me today and soothed the rawness of the "washing machine drum" of emotions I've been experiencing. The song ministered to me and gave me peace. "He takes the gloom and fills the life with glory." Amen

I cannot recall how many times I sat and listen to my father sing this hymn to me and my husband and each time he sang it, it became more special. For my husband this was one of the few sweet memories that he has of my father as he passed away last year around this time. He died of Alheizmers and I remember as he was in the early stages he would continually sing this hymn when we would ask him and he would forget some of the words but sing it anyway. Very special hymn and will remain with us for our life-time!
Growing up, this was one of my mother's favorite hymns. It has become one of mine also. Thanks for the other three verses.
This is one of my favorite testamony songs I still like to sing it. I heard Bro Rolloff sing it in the early 80's. Thanks for giving me the words I did not have vs. 4.

In 1957 I use to sing this hymn round the piano in our lounge in Bara - Sigatoka, Fiji Islands. As there were no electric lights in those days we used the Tiley kerosene lantern which sat on the piano. Our fox terrier dog - Bits - loved the song and she would howl everything she heard the hymn being played and sung.
When I was 14/15 my mum would sing this to me. I miss her so much xxx

Having recently retired I have struggled with many things and my options. As I was working in the house the Lord brought this song to my remembrance. I could only remember part of the chorus and looked it up. I sang this as a small girl, loved it then and still do. Sure ministers to me. Thank you for being here. May God continue to bless you and give you favor....

Hmm...this is one of my favorite classic hymns and I just can't get tired of listening to those wonderful words tell of the power of Jesus as He comes and breaks the power of the Devil and take all pains away. I simply love this hymn.
Amazing love of God is manifested in our Savior who loves us dearly as his own brothers and sisters. I can't think of Him without crying for what He has done on the cross.
My mother sings this to me and has done so for a long time. I love the melody and the lyrics ring true even now.

The first time I heard this song was in the early 1950's when I was in the third grade one of my friends used to sing it and I never forget it. The title as I knew it from an old hymnal is When Jesus came. I guess in so ways we are all beggars and sometimes are blind.

I learned this hymn as a child and never forgot the first stanza. As I laid in bed one night some of the hurtful memories of my youth returned. I then had a dream. I was a beggar, sad, discouraged, and hopeless. Then, in my dream, Jesus came. He walked over to me, embraced me and my heart was filled with joy.

I remember my mother singing this as a solo in every church we attended while I was a child. I think it touched me then because I was an epileptic and I prayed for God to heal me. Another song I loved to hear her sing was "Stranger of Galilee."

I was touched by this song in the 70s when C.W Burpo used it as theme for his radio program. 40 years later it speaks to teens who cut themselves and idealists who wonder is there no solution to evil in the world. There is a triumphant solution. I have this translated into Japanese. Now I'm looking for sheet music to learn to sing this to anyone who needs an answer to their doubts with a touch and an "I will!"

I sang this song in many Big Tent Crusade meetings and watched how people become repentent of their sins and gave their hearts to God.T his started way back in 1969. I want to do it again before Jesus comes!
This was written by my uncle. It thrills my heart that God continues to use its message. As a child I often heard my father sing this solo in missionary meetings. Jesus IS the Redeemer.
We truly need Him to come to us.
I like this song very much. I am Helen's son.
This hymn is based on Scripture; the relief that Christ offers to everyone speaks to all. I know the words of the first stanza. Just wondered why the words are not here.
I like this song because it was written by Dr. Oswald J. Smith, a great preacher and missionary statesman who founded and pastored a church in my hometown of Toronto, Ontario.

Amen Praise the Lord! No longer under the authority of Satan, but GOD! The tempter's powers are now broken..he has no power over the Lord, our Savior..who has saved us. How I love Him! What great a death He has saved me from! No longer empty..unfeeling.. I will praise Him forever! Thank You Lord!<3
I grew up as a Nazarene and heard many of the songs Homer Rodeheaver wrote - but this one always captured my heart to know that Jesus comes in the midst of our troubles and lifts us up.
I sang this song as a young girl for church special. It has a great message for the people to hear. God's miracles never stop. Our world needs to know there is a way to solve our problems.
